alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 8:35AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Columbia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, 117th St between 395th and 400th Ave is flooded * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Monday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 17.9 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 945 AM CDT.
